track.name: Algorithms
track.descriptions: The true test of problem solving: when one realizes that time and memory aren't infinite.

primary_contest.description:
101 Hack November is here! It's all about speed, accuracy and efficiency. Inside the contest are 3 challenges. You have exactly 90 minutes to solve them. Every second counts.

HackerRank invites you to join the contest to compete against hackers from across the globe.
primary_contest.name: 101 Hack November

model.python3_template:
#!/bin/python3

import sys


n,t = input().strip().split(' ')
n,t = [int(n),int(t)]
width = [int(width_temp) for width_temp in input().strip().split(' ')]
for a0 in range(t):
    i,j = input().strip().split(' ')
    i,j = [int(i),int(j)]
model.name: Service Lane
model.php_template:
<?php

$handle = fopen ("php://stdin","r");
fscanf($handle,"%d %d",$n,$t);
$width_temp = fgets($handle);
$width = explode(" ",$width_temp);
array_walk($width,'intval');
for($a0 = 0; $a0 < $t; $a0++){
    fscanf($handle,"%d %d",$i,$j);
}

?>
model.python_template:
#!/bin/python

import sys


n,t = raw_input().strip().split(' ')
n,t = [int(n),int(t)]
width = map(int,raw_input().strip().split(' '))
for a0 in xrange(t):
    i,j = raw_input().strip().split(' ')
    i,j = [int(i),int(j)]
model.ruby_template:
#!/bin/ruby

n,t = gets.strip.split(' ')
n = n.to_i
t = t.to_i
width = gets.strip
width = width.split(' ').map(&:to_i)
for a0 in (0..t-1)
    i,j = gets.strip.split(' ')
    i = i.to_i
    j = j.to_i
end
model.haskell_template:
import Control.Applicative
import Control.Monad
import System.IO


main :: IO ()
main = do
    n_temp <- getLine
    let n_t = words n_temp
    let n = read $ n_t!!0 :: Int
    let t = read $ n_t!!1 :: Int
    width_temp <- getLine
    let width = map read $ words width_temp :: [Int]
    forM_ [1..t] $ \a0  -> do
        i_temp <- getLine
        let i_t = words i_temp
        let i = read $ i_t!!0 :: Int
        let j = read $ i_t!!1 :: Int


getMultipleLines :: Int -> IO [String]

getMultipleLines n
    | n <= 0 = return []
    | otherwise = do          
        x <- getLine         
        xs <- getMultipleLines (n-1)    
        let ret = (x:xs)    
        return ret
model.preview: Calculate the maximum width of the vehicle that can pass through a service lane.
model.clojure_template:
(use '[clojure.string :only (split triml)])

(
        let [
          n_temp (read-line) 
          n_t (split n_temp #"\s+") 
          n (Integer/parseInt (n_t 0)) 
          t (Integer/parseInt (n_t 1)) 
        ]

      (
        let [
          width_temp (read-line) 
          width_t (split width_temp #"\s+") 
          width (map #(Integer/parseInt %) width_t) 
        ]
      )

      (
        loop [a0 t]
        (when (> a0 0)

          (
            let [
              i_temp (read-line) 
              i_t (split i_temp #"\s+") 
              i (Integer/parseInt (i_t 0)) 
              j (Integer/parseInt (i_t 1)) 
            ]
          )

        (recur (- a0 1) ) )
      )

)
model.erlang_template:
-module(solution).
-export([main/0]).

main() ->

    { ok, [N,T]} = io:fread("", "~d~d"),
    Width = read_array(N,"~d"),
    T_list = lists:seq(1,T),
    lists:foreach( fun(T0) ->
            { ok, [I,J]} = io:fread("", "~d~d")
    end,T_list),
    true.

read_array(0,D) -> [];
read_array(N,D) -> 
	{ok, [X]} = io:fread("", D),
	[X | read_array(N-1,D)].

read_2darray(0,M,D) -> [];
read_2darray(N,M,D) ->
	Q=read_array(M,D),
	[Q | read_2darray(N-1,M,D)].
model.lua_template:
n,t = io.read("*number", "*number", "*l")
width = {}
width_temp = io.read()
width_i = 1;
for token in string.gmatch(width_temp, "[^%s]+") do
	width[width_i] = token
	width_i = width_i + 1
end
a0 = 0
while a0 < t do
    i,j = io.read("*number", "*number", "*l")
    a0 = a0 + 1
end
